018package org.tquadrat.foundation.scripting.internal;
019
020import static java.lang.System.err;
021import static javax.tools.ToolProvider.getSystemJavaCompiler;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.scripting.internal.MemoryJavaFileManager.makeStringSource;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
027
028import javax.tools.DiagnosticCollector;
029import javax.tools.JavaFileObject;
030import javax.tools.StandardJavaFileManager;
031import java.io.IOException;
032import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
033import java.io.PrintWriter;
034import java.io.Writer;
035import java.util.ArrayList;
036import java.util.Collection;
037import java.util.List;
038import java.util.Map;
039
040import org.apiguardian.api.API;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ImpossibleExceptionError;
043
044/**
045 *  Simple interface to the Java compiler using the JSR199 Compiler API.
046 *
047 *  @author A. Sundararajan
048 *  @modified    Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
049 *  @version $Id: JavaCompiler.java 1070 2023-09-29 17:09:34Z tquadrat $
050 *  @since 0.0.5
051 *
052 *  @UMLGraph.link
053 */
054@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: JavaCompiler.java 1070 2023-09-29 17:09:34Z tquadrat $" )
055@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
056public final class JavaCompiler
057{
058        /*------------*\
059    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
060        \*------------*/
061    /**
062     *  The compiler instance that is used.
063     */
064    private final javax.tools.JavaCompiler m_Compiler;
065
066    /**
067     *  The Java file manager that is used by the compiler.
068     */
069    private final StandardJavaFileManager m_FileManager;
070
071        /*--------------*\
072    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
073        \*--------------*/
074    /**
075     *  Creates a new {@code JavaCompiler} instance.
076     */
077    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionThrown" )
078    public JavaCompiler()
079    {
080        m_Compiler = getSystemJavaCompiler();
081        if( isNull( m_Compiler ) )
082        {
083            throw new Error( "Unable to load the System Java Compiler" );
084        }
085        m_FileManager = m_Compiler.getStandardFileManager( null, null, null );
086    }   //  JavaCompiler
087
088        /*---------*\
089    ====** Methods **==========================================================
090        \*---------*/
091    /**
092     *  Compiles the given source and returns the resulting byte code. Any
093     *  error messages will be written to
094     *  {@link System#err}.
095     *
096     *  @param  source  The source to compile.
097     *  @param  fileName    The file name that is used for the source origin.
098     *  @return The resulting byte code.
099     */
100    public final Map<String,byte []> compile( final String fileName, final String source )
101    {
102        @SuppressWarnings( {"ImplicitDefaultCharsetUsage", "UseOfSystemOutOrSystemErr"} )
103        final var errorOut = new OutputStreamWriter( err );
104        final var retValue = compile( fileName, source, errorOut, null, null );
105
106        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
107        return retValue;
108    }   //  compile()
109
110    /**
111     *  Compiles the given source and returns the resulting byte code. Any
112     *  error messages will be written to the given
113     *  {@link Writer}.
114     *
115     *  @param  fileName    The file name that is used for the source origin.
116     *  @param  source  The source to compile.
117     *  @param  errorOut    The destination for any error messages.
118     *  @return The resulting byte code.
119     */
120    public final Map<String,byte []> compile( final String fileName, final String source, final Writer errorOut )
121    {
122        return compile( fileName, source, errorOut, null, null );
123    }   //  compile()
124
125    /**
126     *  Compiles the given source and returns the resulting byte code. Any
127     *  error messages will be written to the given
128     *  {@link Writer}.
129     *
130     *  @param  fileName    The file name that is used for the source origin.
131     *  @param  source  The source to compile.
132     *  @param  errorOut    The destination for any error messages.
133     *  @param  sourcePath  The locations of additional {@code *.java} source
134     *      files; multiple folder names have to be separated with colons
135     *      (':').
136     *  @return The resulting byte code.
137     */
138    public final Map<String,byte []> compile( final String fileName, final String source, final Writer errorOut, final String sourcePath )
139    {
140        final var retValue = compile( fileName, source, errorOut, requireNonNullArgument( sourcePath, "sourcePath" ), null );
141
142        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
143        return retValue;
144    }   //  compile()
145
146    /**
147     *  Compiles the given source and returns the resulting byte code. Any
148     *  error messages will be written to the given
149     *  {@link Writer}.
150     *
151     *  @param  fileName    The file name that is used for the source origin.
152     *  @param  source  The source to compile.
153     *  @param  errorOut    The destination for any error messages.
154     *  @param  sourcePath  The location of additional {@code *.java} source
155     *      files; multiple folder names have to be separated with colons
156     *      (':'). May be {@code null}.
157     *  @param  classPath   The location of additional {@code *.class} files;
158     *      multiple folder names have to be separated with colons. May be
159     *      {@code null}.
160     *  @return The resulting byte code.
161     */
162    public final Map<String,byte []> compile( final String fileName, final String source, final Writer errorOut, final String sourcePath, final String classPath )
163    {
164        //---* Define the default javac options *------------------------------
165        final var options = List.of( "-Xlint:all", "-g:none", "-deprecation" );
166
167        final var retValue = compile( fileName, source, errorOut, sourcePath, classPath, options );
168
169        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
170        return retValue;
171    }   //  compile()
172
173    /**
174     *  Compiles the given source and returns the resulting byte code. Any
175     *  error messages will be written to the given
176     *  {@link Writer}.
177     *
178     *  @param  fileName    The file name that is used for the source origin.
179     *  @param  source  The source to compile.
180     *  @param  errorOut    The destination for any error messages.
181     *  @param  sourcePath  The location of additional {@code *.java} source
182     *      files; multiple folder names have to be separated with colons
183     *      (':'). May be {@code null}.
184     *  @param  classPath   The location of additional {@code *.class} files;
185     *      multiple folder names have to be separated with colons
186     *      (':'). May be {@code null}.
187     *  @param  options  The options for the invocation of {@code javac}.
188     *  @return The resulting byte code.
189     */
190    @SuppressWarnings( {"NestedTryStatement", "MethodWithTooManyParameters"} )
191    private Map<String,byte []> compile( final String fileName, final String source, final Writer errorOut, final String sourcePath, final String classPath, final List<String> options )
192    {
193        requireNonNullArgument( fileName, "fileName" );
194        requireNonNullArgument( source, "source" );
195        requireNonNullArgument( errorOut, "errorOut" );
196        requireNonNullArgument( options, "options" );
197
198        /*
199         * The diagnostics collector that collects all the warnings and errors
200         * that may show up on compiling the source.
201         */
202        final var diagnostics = new DiagnosticCollector<JavaFileObject>();
203
204        Map<String,byte []> retValue = null;
205
206        //---* Create a new memory JavaFileManager that takes the result *-----
207        try( final var fileManager = new MemoryJavaFileManager( m_FileManager ) )
208        {
209            //---* Prepare the compilation unit *------------------------------
210            final Collection<JavaFileObject> compilationUnits = new ArrayList<>( 1 );
211            compilationUnits.add( makeStringSource( fileName, source ) );
212
213            //---* Prepare the javac options *---------------------------------
214            final Collection<String> effectiveOptions = new ArrayList<>( options );
215
216            if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( sourcePath ) )
217            {
218                effectiveOptions.add( "-sourcepath" );
219                effectiveOptions.add( sourcePath );
220            }
221
222            if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( classPath ) )
223            {
224                effectiveOptions.add( "-classpath" );
225                effectiveOptions.add( classPath );
226            }
227
228            //---* Create a compilation task *---------------------------------
229            final var task = m_Compiler.getTask( errorOut, fileManager, diagnostics, effectiveOptions, null, compilationUnits );
230
231            if( !task.call() )
232            {
233                try( final var errorPrinter = new PrintWriter( errorOut ) )
234                {
235                    for( final var diagnostic : diagnostics.getDiagnostics() )
236                    {
237                        errorPrinter.println( diagnostic.getMessage( null ) );
238                    }
239                    errorPrinter.flush();
240                }
241            }
242            else
243            {
244                retValue = fileManager.getClassBytes();
245            }
246        }
247        catch( final IOException e )
248        {
249            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "MemoryJavaFileManager should not throw an exception on close()", e );
250        }
251
252        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
253        return retValue;
254    }   //  compile()
255}
256//  class JavaCompiler
257
258/*
259 *  End of File
260 */
